page.title: 06All Saints' Church, Wing
page.content: A large proportion of All Saints' Church was built in the nine hundreds and it is one of the countries best preserved Saxon churches. The first recorded vicar was in 1210. The church belongs to the Oxford diocese and four weekly services are held. There are various activities held at the church, such as a Sunday School, a youth club and flower shows. Underneath the church is a 7th century crypt, which is said to have contained the bones of a saint. The church has had several alterations to its structure in 1649, 1669 and 1657. Inside the tower are six bells which are in regular use.
